usage.description: Creates a line through two points A and B.
Creates a line through the given point parallel to the given line.
Creates a line through the given point with direction vector v.
usage.note: You can also use a parametric syntax to create a line eg X = (1, 2) + r (2, 3) or X = (1, 2, 3) + r (2, 3, 4)

usage.description: Creates the position vector of the given point.
Creates a vector from Start Point to End Point.
Creates a segment between two points.
Creates a segment with the given starting point and length, as well as the end point of the segment.
Creates a semicircle above the segment between the two points and displays its length in Algebra View.
Creates an ellipse with two focal points and semimajor axis length.
usage.note: If the condition: 2*semimajor axis length > Distance between the focus points isn't met, you will get an hyperbola.

usage.description: Creates an ellipse with two focal points, where the length of the semimajor axis equals the length of the given segment.
example: Let s = Segment((0,1), (2,1)) : Ellipse((0, 1), (2, 1), s) yields 3x¬≤ + 4y¬≤ - 6x - 8y = 5

usage.description: Creates an ellipse with two focal points passing through a given point.
Creates a hyperbola with given focus points and semimajor axis length.
usage.note: If the condition: 0 < 2*semimajor axis length < Distance between the focus points isn't met, you will get an ellipse.

usage.description: Creates a hyperbola with given focus points where the length of the semimajor axis equals the length of the segment.
Creates a hyperbola with given focus points passing through a given point.
Creates a parabola with focal point and the line as directrix.
example: Let a = Line((0,1), (2,1)). Parabola((3, 3), a) yields x¬≤ - 6x - 4y = -17

usage.description: Creates a circle with given center and radius.
Creates a circle with given center and radius equal to the length of the given segment.
Creates a circle with given center through a given point.
Creates a circle through the three given points (if they do not lie on the same line).
Creates a circle with line as axis and through the point.
Creates a circle with center, radius, and axis parallel to direction, which can be a line, vector or plane.

description: Creates a conic sector and calculates its area.

usage.description: Yields a conic sector between two points on the conic section and calculates its area. Only works for circles and ellipses.
example: Let c: x¬≤ + 2y¬≤ = 8 be an ellipse, D = (-2.83, 0) and E = (0, -2) two points on the ellipse. Sector(c, D, E) yields d = 4.44
Let c: x¬≤ + y¬≤ = 9 be a circle, A = (3, 0) and B = (0, 3) two points on the circle. Sector(c, A, B) yields d = 7.07

usage.description: Yields a conic sector between two parameter values between 0 and 2œÄ on the conic section and calculates its area.
usage.note: Internally uses parametric forms: Circle: (r cos(t), r sin(t)) where r is radius. Ellipse: (a cos(t), b sin(t)) where a,b are semimajor/minor axes.
example: Let c: x¬≤ + y¬≤ = 9 be a circle. Sector(c, 0, 3/4 œÄ) yields d = 10.6

usage.description: Creates a circular arc with midpoint between the two points.
Creates a circular sector with midpoint between the two points.
Creates a circular arc through three points, where the first point is the starting point and the third point is the endpoint of the circumcircular arc.
Creates a circular sector whose arc runs through the three points, where the first point is the starting point and the third point is the endpoint of the arc.
Creates a cone with given base and height.
Creates a cone with vertex (second point), circle center (first point) and given radius.
Creates an infinite cone with given point as vertex, axis of symmetry parallel to the given vector and apex angle 2Œ±.
usage.note: This command yields undefined if angle ‚â• ùúã/2.

usage.description: Creates a cube having as base the given square.

Creates a cube having the segment between the two points as an edge. The other vertices are uniquely determined by the given direction, that should be one of: a vector, a segment, a line, a ray orthogonal to the segment, or a polygon, a plane parallel to the segment. The created cube will have: a face with the segment as an edge in a plane orthogonal to the given vector/segment/line/ray, or a face with the segment as an edge in a plane parallel to the polygon/plane.
Creates a cube with three (adjacent) points of the first face. The points have to start a square for the cube to be defined.
Creates a cube with two (adjacent) points of the first face, and the third point automatically created on a circle, so that the cube can rotate around its first edge.
usage.note: Cube(A, B) is a shortcut for Cube(A, B, C) with C = Point(Circle(B, Distance(A, B), Segment(A, B))).

usage.description: Creates a cylinder with given base and given height.
Creates a cylinder with given radius and with given points as the centers of the top and bottom.
Creates a dodecahedron having the given regular pentagon as base.

Creates a dodecahedron having the segment between two points as an edge. The other vertices are univocally determined by the given direction, that needs to be: a vector, a segment, a line, a ray orthogonal to the segment, or a polygon, a plane parallel to the segment. The created dodecahedron will have: a face with the segment as an edge in a plane orthogonal to the given vector/segment/line/ray, or a face with the segment as an edge in a plane parallel to the polygon/plane.
Creates a dodecahedron with three (adjacent) points of the first face. The points have to start a regular pentagon for the dodecahedron to be defined.
Creates a dodecahedron with two (adjacent) points of the first face, and the third point automatically created on a circle, so that the dodecahedron can rotate around its first edge.
usage.note: Dodecahedron(A, B) is a shortcut for Dodecahedron(A, B, C) with C = Point(Circle(((1 - sqrt(5)) A + (3 + sqrt(5)) B) / 4, Distance(A, B) sqrt(10 + 2sqrt(5)) / 4, Segment(A, B))).

usage.description: Creates an icosahedron having as base the given equilateral triangle.

Creates an icosahedron having the segment between the two points as an edge. The other vertices are univocally determined by the given direction, that needs to be: a vector, a segment, a line, a ray orthogonal to the segment, or a polygon, a plane parallel to the segment. The created icosahedron will have: a face with the segment as an edge in a plane orthogonal to the given vector/segment/line/ray, or a face with the segment as an edge in a plane parallel to the polygon/plane.
Creates an icosahedron with the three points of the first face. The points have to draw an equilateral triangle for the icosahedron to be defined.
Creates an icosahedron with the two points of the first face, and the third point automatically created on a circle, so that the icosahedron can rotate around its first edge.
usage.note: Icosahedron(A, B) is a shortcut for Icosahedron(A, B, C) with C = Point(Circle(Midpoint(A, B), Distance(A, B) sqrt(3) / 2, Segment(A, B))).

description: Creates the incircle of a triangle.

usage.description: Creates the incircle of the triangle formed by the three points. The incircle is the circle that is tangent to all three sides of the triangle.
example: Let O=(0, 0), A=(3, 0) and B=(0, 5) be three points: Incircle(O, A, B) yields (x - 1.08)¬≤ + (y - 1.08)¬≤ = 1.18 in Algebra View and draws the corresponding circle in Graphics View.

usage.description: Creates an infinite cone with given point as vertex, axis of symmetry parallel to the given vector and apex angle 2Œ±.
Creates an infinite cone with given first point as vertex, line through two points as axis of symmetry and apex angle 2Œ±.
Creates an infinite cone with given point as vertex, axis of symmetry parallel to given line and apex angle 2Œ±.
Creates an infinite cylinder with given point on axis, axis of symmetry parallel to the given vector and radius.
Creates an infinite cylinder with axis through two points and given radius.
Creates an infinite cylinder with given line as axis and radius.
Creates an octahedron having as base the given equilateral triangle.

Creates an octahedron having the segment between the two points as an edge. The other vertices are univocally determined by the given direction, that needs to be: a vector, a segment, a line, a ray orthogonal to the segment, or a polygon, a plane parallel to the segment. The created octahedron will have: a face with the segment as an edge in a plane orthogonal to the given vector/segment/line/ray, or a face with the segment as an edge in a plane parallel to the polygon/plane.
Creates an octahedron with the three points of the first face. The points have to draw an equilateral triangle for the octahedron to be defined.

Creates an octahedron with the two points of the first face, and the third point automatically created on a circle, so that the octahedron can rotate around its first edge. Octahedron(A, B) is a shortcut for Octahedron(A, B, C) with C = Point(Circle(Midpoint(A, B), Distance(A, B) sqrt(3) / 2, Segment(A, B))).
Creates the plane containing the given polygon.
Creates the plane containing the conic.
Creates the plane through the given point, parallel to the given plane.
Creates the plane through the given point and line.
Creates the plane through the lines (that must be intersecting or parallel to each other).
Creates the plane through the given points.
Creates the plane through the given point and having as normal vector the cross product of the given vectors (that must not be collinear).

description: Creates a polygon such as a triangle, square, quadrilateral, pentagon, hexagon, etc.

usage.description: Creates a polygon defined by the given points.
Creates a regular polygon with n vertices.
usage.note: Other points are automatically created to form a regular polygon. Thus, if you want to use vertices as point object, you should use the command Polygon( <Point>, <Point>, <Point>, ... ) instead.

usage.description: Creates a regular polygon with n vertices, and directed by the direction (e.g. a plane to which the polygon will be parallel, if possible).
Creates a prism defined by the given points.
usage.note: Prism(A, B, C, D) creates the prism with base ABC and top DEF. The vectors AD, BE, CF are equal.

usage.description: Creates a prism with the given polygon as base and the point as first top point.
usage.note: Prism(poly1, A) creates a prism with base poly1 and top point A.

usage.description: Creates a right prism with the polygon as base and given height.
usage.note: Prism(poly1, 3) creates a prism with base poly1 and height 3.

usage.description: Creates a pyramid defined by the given points.
usage.note: Pyramid(A, B, C, D) creates the pyramid with base ABC and apex D.

usage.description: Creates a pyramid with the given polygon as base and the point as apex.
usage.note: Pyramid(poly1, A) creates a pyramid with base poly1 and apex A.

usage.description: Creates a centered pyramid defined by the polygon as base and given height.
usage.note: Pyramid(poly1, 3) creates a centered pyramid with base poly1 and height 3.

usage.description: Creates a sphere with center and radius.
Creates a sphere with center in the first point through the second point.
Creates a tetrahedron having as base the given equilateral triangle.

Creates a tetrahedron having the segment between the two points as an edge. The other vertices are univocally determined by the given direction, that needs to be: a vector, a segment, a line, a ray orthogonal to the segment, or a polygon, a plane parallel to the segment. The created tetrahedron will have: a face with the segment as an edge in a plane orthogonal to the given vector/segment/line/ray, or a face with the segment as an edge in a plane parallel to the polygon/plane.
Creates a tetrahedron with the three points of the first face. The points have to draw an equilateral triangle for the tetrahedron to be defined.
Creates a tetrahedron with the two points of the first face, and the third point automatically created on a circle, so that the tetrahedron can rotate around its first edge.
usage.note: Tetrahedron(A, B) is a shortcut for Tetrahedron(A, B, C) with C = Point(Circle(Midpoint(A, B), Distance(A, B) sqrt(3) / 2, Segment(A, B))).

description: Creates a parametric curve in 2D or 3D.

usage.description: Creates a 2D parametric curve using x and y expressions with the given parameter variable over the specified interval.
usage.note: End Value must be greater than or equal to Start Value and both must be finite. x, y and z cannot be used as parameter variables.
example: Curve(2 cos(t), 2 sin(t), t, 0, 2œÄ) creates a circle with radius 2 around the origin

usage.description: Creates a 3D parametric curve using x, y and z expressions with the given parameter variable over the specified interval.
usage.note: End Value must be greater than or equal to Start Value and both must be finite. x, y and z cannot be used as parameter variables.
example: Curve(cos(t), sin(t), t, t, 0, 10œÄ) creates a 3D spiral
